intro: Abutilon avicennae, commonly known as the Indian velvet tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its velvety, hairy leaves and showy, lantern-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate. Abutilon avicennae is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its unique appearance and adaptability.

It is also present in parts of Australia and the Pacific Islands. Its native distribution reflects its adaptation to saline and waterlogged soils.
